CatDescriptText: Mrs. Virginia McCune, housewife, Homewood and Mrs. Evelyn Capp, beautician, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 11, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think Negroes over-emphasize "social life" as it pertains to entertainment?  If so, can you suggest a remedy for "curing it."  Mrs. McCune's answer reads: "No, I don't think we do."  Mrs. Capp's answer reads: "No, I don't.  We should have some time to enjoy ourselves."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Virginia McCune wearing dark dress with light colored buttons and overcoat with wavy striped pattern, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Evelyn Capp wearing light colored gingham shirt and leather coat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
